subject: Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... not that i m aware of.  there is TestNG (http://www.beust.com/testng) in the interim. my wish list for TigerUnit : -- use native Java assertion mechanism
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Danijel Arsenovski" <darsenovski@a...>
wrote:
> It seems that new metadata capability in Java (in tiger) could be
> quite useful in order to replace name conventions in junit.
> Are there any plans in that direction?

not that i'm aware of. there is TestNG (http://www.beust.com/testng)
in the interim.

my wish list for "TigerUnit":

-- use native Java assertion mechanism in Assert methods
-- make Assert no longer a superclass of TestCase. to use Assert's
methods unqualified, use static import
-- annotations for test fixture, test method, setup method, teardown
method, fixture setup method, fixture teardown method, test category
a la NUnit
-- ability to build suites by mixing and matching on category,
package, and other criteria...

ah, but to make time to get such a thing going....8^) probably best
to contribute to TestNG instead.

--p
